sen.j: 日本における貴族の歴史を概観すると、ヤマト王権期の豪族層に由来する古代貴族がまず形成された後、平安時代前期には従来の古代貴族に代わって藤原氏や源氏が上流貴族層を占めていった。
sen.e: Taking a general view of Kizoku history in Japan, ancient Kizoku originated in the Gozoku (local ruling family) class that was first established in the Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) period, and then in the first half of the Heian period, the Fujiwara clan and the Minamoto clan became to occupy the upper Kizoku class, replacing the former ancient Kizoku class.

sen.e: On the other hand, in the medieval period, the movement to make the uppermost class of the samurai (called Buke-no-toryo: literally, the head of samurai families) join the Kizoku class continued, and entering the early-modern times, as the family statuses became to be fixed, the shogun family and the daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) class became to form the Buke (samurai)-kizoku.

sen.j: 明治維新期に至り、公家貴族と武家貴族を中心とする上流階級が華族へと移行したが、太平洋戦争での敗戦に伴い華族制度は廃止され、日本の貴族は消滅した(ただし、皇族は除く)。
sen.e: Entering the Meiji restoration period, the socially upper classes, centered on Kuge-kizoku and Buke-kizoku, became to be included in the class called Kazoku, and then the Kazoku system was abolished after Japan was defeated in the Pacific War, making Kizoku in Japan extinct (however, excluding Kozoku (Imperial families)).

sen.e: Akiko YOSHIE proposes the theory that the locality and ryozokusei (両属性) having been possessed by clans was lost in this era, making the clans reorganized.

sen.j: 宇根俊範は、桓武天皇は従来と異なる方針で諸氏族の改賜姓を行い、このため貴族社会における各氏族の序列が大きく変化し、源平藤橘を頂点とする新たな貴族社会秩序が生じたとする。
sen.e: Toshinori UNE proposes the theory that Emperor Kanmu changed family names of clans based on a policy different from that in the past, and that, therefore, the order of clans in the Kizoku society changed drastically, generating a new Kizoku society order with the Minnesota clan, the Taira clan, the Fujiwara clan, and the Tachibana clan at its pinnacle.

sen.j: 平安時代初期の議政官を見ると、藤原氏のほか、源氏、橘氏、清原氏、菅原氏などのように、奈良時代には見られなかった氏族が急速に台頭していた。
sen.e: Viewing the Giseikan officer names in the early Heian period, the names of clans that had not been in the Nara periods, such as the Minamoto clan, the Tachibana clan, the Kiyohara clan, and the Sugawara clan, appeared suddenly, in addition of the name of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 880年ごろには、議政官氏族の多様性が失われ、藤原氏・源氏が議政官のほとんどを占めるようになった。
sen.e: In around 880s, the clan diversity of the Giseikan officers was lost, with most of the officers occupied by persons from the Fujiwara clan or from the Minamoto clan.

sen.j: 藤原氏は摂政・関白の地位を獲得し、それを世襲することに成功した。
sen.e: The Fujiwara clan secured the Sessho (regent) and Kanpaku (top adviser to the emperor) posts, and was successful to make these posts inherited.

sen.j: 以降、10世紀から11世紀にかけて、藤原氏嫡流（摂関家）は、天皇の外戚、すなわちミウチとして代々摂関となって貴族社会の頂点に位置し、10世紀から11世紀にかけて摂関政治と呼ばれる政治形態を布いた。
sen.e: Later, in the era from the tenth century to the eleventh century, persons in the main linage of the Fujiwara clan (the Sekkan (indicating both Sessho and Kanpaku) family) were placed at the top of the Kizoku society by occupying the Sekkan posts for generations as a maternal relative of the emperor, or a member of the Imperial family, establishing the political form called Sekkan politics in the era from the tenth century to the eleventh century.

sen.j: ただし、通俗的な理解とは異なり、摂関家は専横的に権力を振るったわけではない。
sen.e: However, contrary to the common understanding, the Sekkan families did not use their power exclusively for their own favors.

sen.j: 摂関といえど独裁的な国政決定を行なうことはできず、重要な国政決定はすべて陣定などの公卿会議を通じて行なわれていたのである。
sen.e: Even persons at Sekkan families could not decide national political affairs autocratically, and all nationally important political affairs were decided through a conference, for example, Jin no sadame (an ancient cabinet council), whose members were Kugyo.

sen.j: 先述したとおり、9世紀後半から10世紀にかけての時期に、上流貴族が藤原氏・源氏にほぼ限定されると、他氏族は中下流貴族として存続する道を模索し始めた。
sen.e: In the era from towards the latter half of the ninth century to the tenth century when almost all of the upper Kizoku members became occupied by persons from the Fujiwara clan or from the Minamoto clan, as described above, the other clan members started to find the ways of remaining as middle or lower Kizoku class members.

sen.j: 10世紀初頭、王朝国家体制への移行に伴い、律令機構や権能を特定者へ請け負わせる官司請負制が行なわれ始めた。
sen.e: In the early tenth century when the nation-governing system was changed to an ocho kokka (royal-court state) system, the Kanshiukeoisei system, in which Ritsuryo-based functions and rights were entrusted to specific persons, started.

sen.j: そうすると、機構・権能の請負いに成功した中下流貴族は、その機構・権能を家業と位置づけ、それを世襲する家業の継承を行なうようになった。
sen.e: Then, middle or lower Kizoku members who were successfully entrusted with such a function or right positioned the function or right as that to be executed as their family business, becoming to inherit it as the hereditary family business for generations.

sen.j: 例えば、武芸・軍事を家業とする中下流貴族は「兵（つわもの）の家」と呼ばれ、押領・追捕・追討活動に従事する軍事貴族となり、武士の母体となっている。
sen.e: For example, the middle or lower Kizoku families engaged in military art or military affairs were called "Tsuwamono no ie" (warrior families) and became military Kizoku engaged in activities of seizing, searching and capturing, or hunting down and killing criminals, constituting a base for samurai.

sen.e: Kanshiukeoi (actions based on the Kanshiueoisei system) and the inheritance of such family businesses became to appear widely in the Kizoku society in the eleventh century and later.

sen.e: The first half of the tenth century, when the Sessho-based politics, the Kanshiukeoi system, and the inheritance of such family businesses started, was also the era when the standard styles of rituals in the Imperial court and of religious rituals were established.

sen.j: 非常に多数の年中行事からなる儀式は、細部まで作法・様式が決められており、儀式を滞りなく執り行うため、『西宮記』『北山抄』などの儀式書も作られた。
sen.e: For the rituals consisting of numerous yearly events, detailed etiquette and patterns were determined, and such books concerned with the rituals as "Saikyuki" and "Hokuzansho" were written to execute these rituals smoothly.

sen.e: The "family" concept that appeared in the Kizoku society reached up to Emperor in the latter half of the eleventh century, starting the Insei political style in which the head of the Imperial family administered the affairs of the state as the retired emperor.

sen.e: Until around the eleventh century, a major economical base of Kizoku was placed on the iden and/or ifu supplied by the state, as in the Nara period, and not much income was available from shoen.

sen.e: In the era from the latter half of the eleventh century to the twelfth century, the number of shoen increased rapidly, and Kokugaryo (territories governed by a provincial government office) were reorganized correspondingly, establishing the medieval tax collection system called Shoen Koryo sei (the system of public lands and private estates).

sen.j: 武力をもって朝廷に仕える鎌倉幕府が武家と呼ばれるようになると、従来の貴族は、政務一般で朝廷に奉仕する文官、すなわち公家と呼ばれるようになった。

sen.j: 東国を支配する幕府を武家政権とするのに対し、中央の朝廷を公家政権ともいう。
sen.e: While the bakufu, controlling the Togoku region, was called the Buke government, the Imperial court, located in the center of the nation, was called the Kuge government as well.

sen.e: The controllable areas of the Kamakura bakufu was initially limited to the Togoku region, not reaching the Saigoku (the western part of Japan) region where was under control of the Imperial court.

sen.j: しかしながら、承久3年（1221年）の承久の乱の勝利によって幕府が優勢となり、朝廷の監視や皇位継承者の決定への参与、西国への進出により支配権を広めていく。
sen.e: However, becoming dominant through the win of the Jokyu war in 1221, the bakufu became to participate in the watch of the Imperial court as well as in deciding the person to inherit the emperor post, extending its control right through an advance into the Saigoku region.

sen.j: 朝廷（公家政権）はその後も存続してはおり、時には幕府（武家政権）と共同で政治問題の解決にあたったが、徐々に政治・統治能力を失っていくこととなった。
sen.e: The Imperial court (Kuge government) continued existing thereafter as well, and sometimes made efforts, together with the bakufu (Buke government), to solve political problems, but gradually lost its political and governing powers.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の貴族の主要な収入源は、平安末期と同様、荘園所領及び知行国であった。

sen.e: Because, entering the Muromachi period, strong power was given to Shugo (the military commander and administrator in a province), Shugo, replacing Jito, became to erode shoen more conspicuously.

sen.e: In this way, the control of Shoen (manors) and Koryo (public lands) by Kizoku was gradually lost, and the Shoen Koryo sei had almost collapsed by the latter half of the 15th century, the middle era of the Muromachi era,

sen.j: 貴族は中央（京）に在住し、地方の荘園・公領からの収入が京進されるのを待つのが室町初期までの通例だった。
sen.e: It was customary until the early Muromachi period that Kizoku resided in the capital (Kyoto) and waited for the income that was to be brought to Kyoto from the shoen and Koryo concerned.

sen.e: However, after that, they sent his Daikan (representative) directly to his Shoen manor (called Ukeoi-daikansei: literally, a Daikan-entrusting system), and there were even the cases in which a Kizoku member himself went to his Shoen manor to control it.

sen.j: また、京都に基盤を置く室町幕府の開始とともに、公家政権の機能も幕府へと移っていく、足利義満執政期に公家政権は政権としての機能をほぼ失った。
sen.e: Furthermore, following the start of the Muromachi bakufu whose base was located in Kyoto, the functions of the Kuge government became to be transferred to the bakufu as well, and the Kuge government almost lost its functions as a government in the era of the Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA administration.

sen.e: Having lost the economic bases as well as the political power, the persons in the Kizoku class suffered from dire poverty in the era from the middle of the Muromachi period to the Sengoku period (period of warring states) (in Japan).

sen.e: In the early modern times, after the Edo bakufu was established, it was attempted to restructure the social status system that had become scarcely functional in the Sengoku period.

sen.e: For the persons in the Kizoku class, the bakufu established Kinchu narabini kuge shohatto (a set of regulations that were applied to the emperor and the Kuge nobles), forcing the Kuge society to be controlled by the bakufu.

sen.e: In the Kuge society, family statuses had become fixed in the Kamakura period and later.

sen.e: However, entering the Edo period, the Kugyo (the top court officials) families from the Kamakura period became called Kyuke (old families), and those that joined Kugyo in the Azuchi-Momoyama period or later Shinke (new families), reorganizing the Kuge family statuses.

sen.e: On the other hand, even in the samurai classes that had been fluid for a long period of time, the family status of each samurai family became fixed corresponding to the stabilization of the society, and the shogun family and daimyo class families, which had inherited their upper samurai class positions, came to form so-called Buke-kizoku (samurai Kizoku).

sen.e: Privileges in social statutes as well as in properties were given to the Kazoku members, and when the Constitution of the Empire of Japan was established in 1889, they were given the privilege of becoming a member of the House of Peers (in Japan).

sen.e: In republican Rome, citizens were divided into the two classes of Kizoku (plebeius) and common people (patricius), and initially, the politics were controlled by Kizoku, with the administrative rulers, including the members of the Chamber of Elders, exclusively occupied by Kizoku.

The local officials in national-boundary areas were called Markgraf, later becoming marquis.

sen.j: 上記以外の豪族で強力なものが後に男爵と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Powerful local ruling families, other than those described above, became to be called baron later.
Powerful local ruling families, other than those described above, were later called baron.
Powerful local ruling families, other than those described above, were later called baron.

sen.j: ドイツでは、ゲルマン部族制が残っており、広大な地域を領有する部族長がデューク (称号)となる。
sen.e: With the Germanic tribe system still remaining in Germany, the tribe heads who possess a vast territory become duke (a title).
With the Germanic tribe system still remaining in Germany, the tribe heads who possessed a vast territory become duke (a title).
With the Germanic tribe system still remaining in Germany, the tribe heads who possessed a vast territory become duke (a title).

sen.j: 他の地域では王族などで広大な領地を与えられたものが公爵となっている。
sen.e: In other regions, the persons who are, for example, a member of a royal family and are given a vast territory become duke.
In other regions, persons who are, for example, a member of a royal family and are given a vast territory, became duke.

sen.j: 当初、伯爵より下の位で副伯と呼ばれたものが子爵となる。
sen.e: The title that was placed under count and was initially called vice-count has become viscount.
The title placed under count, initially called vice-count became viscount.
The title placed under count, initially called vice-count became viscount.

sen.j: 騎士は当初は騎馬で戦う戦士の名誉称号だったが、やがて貴族の称号を持たない者の称号となった。
sen.e: Knight was initially a honorary title for warriors who fought on a horse, but later became the title who possessed no Kizoku title.
A Knight was initially a honorary title for warriors who fought on a horse, but later became onewho held the no Kizoku title.

sen.j: 一方、北イタリア等の都市国家（ヴェネツィア、フィレンツェ等）は共和制ローマの貴族の衣鉢を継いでおり、世襲で元老院議員となる者や、金や功績により新たに元老議員に選ばれた者などが貴族に当たる。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Kizoku system in city states in northern Italy (such as Venice and Florence) followed the tradition in republican Rome, and the Kizoku consisted of hereditary members of the Chamber of Elders and the new members of the Chamber of Elders who were selected using money or due to their contributions.

On the other hand, the Kizoku system in city states in northern Italy (such as Venice and Florence) followed the tradition in republican Rome, and Kizoku consisted of hereditary members of the Chamber of Elders and new members of the Chamber of Elders who were selected by using money or due to their contributions.

On the other hand, the Kizoku system in city states in northern Italy (such as Venice and Florence) followed the tradition in republican Rome, and Kizoku consisted of hereditary members of the Chamber of Elders and new members of the Chamber of Elders who were selected by using money or due to their contributions.

sen.j: しかし、やがて多くの都市国家で実力者が僭主（シニョーレ、signore）となり、さらにローマ教皇や神聖ローマ皇帝から爵位をもらって小公国を作るようになる（例：フィレンツェのメディチ家→トスカーナ大公）。
sen.e: However, over time, the powerful persons in many city states became signore, and also became to establish small principalities by obtaining titles from pope or from Holy Roman Emperor (for example, the Medici family in Florence -> Grand duke of Toscana).

However, over time, powerful persons in many city states became signore, and also established small principalities by obtaining titles from the pope or from the Holy Roman Emperor (for example, the Medici family in Florence -> Grand duke of Toscana).

sen.j: 近世に入り、王権が強化され中央集権化が進むと、封建貴族は支配地を失い宮廷貴族となり、王の役人や軍事的、政治的功績があった者が新たに貴族に任命されるようになった。
sen.e: Entering the early modern times, as the king's right was strengthened and power became increasingly more centralized, feudal Kizoku lost their territories and became Kizoku in the court, and officers for King and the persons who contributed significantly, militarily or administratively, became to be newly appointed to Kizoku.

sen.j: イギリスにおいても現在の貴族の大部分は、この時期に新たに任命されたものである。
sen.e: In England as well, most of present Kizoku were appointed newly to Kizoku in this era.
In England as well, most of present Kizoku were appointed newly to Kizoku in this era.

sen.j: 近代の市民革命により、多くの国で貴族の称号は廃止されるか、特権を持たない名前だけになった。
sen.e: Through people's revolutions in the modern times, the titles of Kizoku were abolished in many nations, or remained nominally with no privilege given.
Through people's revolutions in modern times, titles of Kizoku were abolished in many nations, or remained nominally with no privileges allowed.

sen.j: 王制を維持している国（イギリス、オランダ、ベルギー、デンマーク、スペイン、スカンディナヴィア3国等）では若干の特権が残っているが、ほとんどは形式的なものである（会社員や公務員勤めをしている侯爵家当主さえいる）。
sen.e: In the nations where monarchy is still maintained (such as England, the Netherlands, Belgium, Denmark, Spain, and the three Scandinavian nations), a few privileges of Kizoku still remain, but almost all of them are only nominal (some marquis family heads work as company employees or government officers).

In the nations where a monarchy is still maintained (such as England, the Netherlands, Belgium, Denmark, Spain, and the three Scandinavian nations), a few privileges of Kizoku still remain, but almost all of them are only nominal (some marquis family heads work as company employees or government officers).

In the nations where a monarchy is still maintained (such as England, the Netherlands, Belgium, Denmark, Spain, and the three Scandinavian nations), a few privileges of Kizoku still remain, but almost all of them are only nominal (some marquis family heads work as company employees or government officers).

sen.j: また王制は廃止されているが、貴族制度を存続している国（イタリア、ポルトガル）もある。
sen.e: Some nations (Italy and Portugal) maintain a Kizoku system, even though having abolished monarchy.
Some nations (Italy and Portugal) maintain a Kizoku system, even though having abolished the monarchy.

sen.j: こちらもまた若干の特権がある。
sen.e: In these nations, Kizoku possesses a few privileges as well.
